page.title: 18THE L.S.A. POST-WAR YEARS.
page.content: After the war the Ministry of Agriculture acquired all the estates and appointed the L.S.A. as their agent for the management of them. All new tenants had to have a minimum of 5 years agricultural experience and to find at least a quarter of the working capital.Tenants were brought more fully into consultation both locally and nationally. The increased security brought increasing effeciency and tenants increased their stock and equipment. The importance of growing more tomatoes and lettuces under glass was realised and the area under glass increased tremendously. The measure of prosperity continued until the 1970's but then the increasing imports of tomatoes and salad crops from E.E.C.countries brought about a decline in profits and finally the demise of the L.S.A.in 1983
